alert.note: Alert for Crosby; Dickens; Garza; Kent (Texas) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Lubbock (Lubbock and South Plains Texas)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 01 at 12:58PM CDT by NWS Lubbock
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of western Kent, southwestern Dickens, Garza and southern Crosby Counties through 130 PM CDT... At 1258 PM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 6 miles northwest of Justiceburg, or 8 miles southeast of Post, moving east at 15 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Post, Crosbyton, Spur, Dickens, Lake Alan Henry, White River Lake, Kalgary, Caprock, Southland, Justiceburg and Clairemont. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
